name: 鄭以旋
objective:
This course is designed for undergraduate students to develop their academic English language skills in preparation for an all-English learning environment. Students will engage actively in a variety of academic writing and speaking activities. Students will also learn general English syntax and structure of an academic essay as well as strategies for delivering a successful presentation for academic purposes.

Any inquiry please contact Ms. Chen (chihhsuanchen@mail.ntut.edu.tw) or Ms. Huang (yushanhuang@mail.ntut.edu.tw) at the Media Center.
scorePolicy:
40% 　　GEPT Speaking and Writing Test (tentatively scheduled on May 15)
30% 　　Writing
30% 　　Speaking

•　　Late submission of assignment(s) will only be accepted upon presentation of approval for leave from the university system.
•　　At the lecturer’s sole discretion, a make-up test may be granted upon presentation of approval for leave from the university system no later than 5 days after the date of test. The format of the make-up exam will be determined by the lecturer.
•　　Any act of plagiarism will result in a grade of zero for this course. At the lecturer’s sole discretion, an act of plagiarism may be reported to the university as misconduct.
materials:
Cambridge Academic Writing Skills Student's Book Level 2
Great Writing, National Geographic Learning, Book 4
remarks: Prerequisite to take the course: CEFR B1 or equivalent. Admission interviews will be held in Week 1.
